column4: did anyone here build a gcc-4.7 snapshot on ubuntu successfully? i have tried quite a few times... and failed :(
ps. the gcc-snapshot package that is currently installable from oneric is from october 2011
well there not guaranteed to build at all. Ill try the latest and see what happens
i am trying that myself. thanks.
im failing at building libiberty, most likely due to new code only partially being introduced. there could be a patch on the mailing list. but Im not going to search for it.
i just downloaded the frozen 4.7 snapshot for ubuntu from launchpad. which is supposed to be patched. or so i assume. building it now. *crossed fingers*
why exactly are you trying to build a snapshot?
crti.o would be created while building, it looks like someone messed up the makefile
why not use a stable build of gcc?
4.6 doesn't support a lot of the new C++11 things... like regex or using typedef
i thought there were patches for them?
